intro: Pycnandra griseosepala, commonly known as the grey-sepaled pycnandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a waxy texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and taxonomic studies.
